sen.j: 土工司（どこうし）は律令制において宮内省に属する機関の一つである。
sen.e: Dokoshi is one of the institutions belonging to Kunaisho (Ministry of the Sovereign's Household) in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

Dokoshi (Public Works Office) was one of the institutions belonging to Kunaisho (Ministry of the Sovereign's Household) in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: Dokoshiの補足追加 (参照: http://www.unterstein.net/or/docs/JapanRanks.pdf)、is→wasに修正
sen.e: Dokoshi (Public Works Office) was one of the institutions belonging to Kunaisho (Ministry of the Sovereign's Household) in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: 土工司は木工寮の建築事業に対して土木事業､特に建築資材（石灰・瓦等）の生産を行っていた。
sen.e: Dokoshi produced building materials (caustic lime, tile and so on) in particular for building operations of Mokuryo (Bureau of Carpentry).
Dokoshi produced building materials (caustic lime, tile and so on) in particular for building operations of Mokuryo (Bureau of Carpentry).
Dokoshi produced building materials (caustic lime, tile and so on) in particular for building operations of Mokuryo (Bureau of Carpentry).

sen.j: そのために律令制期の官吏制度である泥部（ぬりべ）と律令制期の官吏制度である泥戸（ぬりこ）が付属しており生産にあたった。
sen.e: For this reason, nuribe and nuriko (plasterer) of government official system during Ritsuryo system period belonged to dokoshi and produced them.
For this reason, nuribe and nuriko (plasterer) of government official system during the Ritsuryo system period belonged to Dokoshi and produced them.
sen.cmt: the Ritsuryo system period、Dokoshiとし、余分なスペース消去
sen.e: For this reason, nuribe and nuriko (plasterer) of government official system during the Ritsuryo system period belonged to Dokoshi and produced them.

sen.j: 木工寮に併合されたとするが時期は不詳である。
sen.e: It was incorporated into Mokuryo, but the time is unknown.
It was incorporated into Mokuryo, but the time is unknown.
It was incorporated into Mokuryo, but the time is unknown.

sen.j: 延喜式にはすでに土工司の職掌を木工寮が担っているためおそらくそれ以前のことと推測される。
sen.e: In "the Engishiki" (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), Mokuryo already had an official duty of dokoshi and thus the time is estimated to have been before that.
In the Engishiki (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), Mokuryo already had an official duty of dokoshi and thus the time is estimated to have been before that.
sen.cmt: 原文表記に合わせ"the Engishiki"のクォーテーション消去
sen.e: In the Engishiki (an ancient book for codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), Mokuryo already had an official duty of dokoshi and thus the time is estimated to have been before that.
Okimi (corresponding to Jurokui (Junior Sixth Rank) and Shorokui (Senior Sixth Rank)) one member.
Kami (director) (corresponding to Shorokuinoge [Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade]) one member.
sen.cmt: Okimi→Kamiに修正、補足追加「従六位正六位」→リンク先の単語と混ざっているため、ウェブ記載の「正六位下」を転記・訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: Kami (director) (corresponding to Shorokuinoge [Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade]) one member.
Jo (secretary) (corresponding to Jurokui and Shohachi-i (Senior Eighth Rank)) one member.
Jo (secretary) (corresponding to Shohachiinojo [Senior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade]) one member.
sen.cmt: 「従六位正八位」→リンク先の単語と混ざっているため、ウェブ記載の「正八位上」を転記・訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: Jo (secretary) (corresponding to Shohachiinojo [Senior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade]) one member.

sen.j: 令史（大初位下相当）一名
sen.e: Reishi (corresponding to Jurokui and Daishoi (Great Initial Rank)) one member.
Reishi (corresponding to Daihatsuinoge [Greater Initial Rank, Lower Grade]) one member.
sen.cmt: 「従六位大初位」→リンク先の単語と混ざっているため、ウェブ記載の「大初位下」を転記・訳文を修正しました。
sen.e: Reishi (corresponding to Daihatsuinoge [Greater Initial Rank, Lower Grade]) one member.
